name: blocked
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
If something is blocked, no-one or nothing can move through it: The road is blocked – you'll have to go round the other way. I've got a blocked (up) nose. Synonyms
gridlocked
jammed (STUCK)
stuck
prevented from reaching somewhere by someone or something: He scored by hitting a rebound from a blocked shot in the penalty box.
unable to be used: The money was in a blocked account to which he had no access. If kids want access to a blocked website, they have to get permission from their parents.
More examplesFewer examplesThe patient had one artery that was completely blocked.A partially blocked drain contributed to the flooding.They were the worst seats in the theater, with a partially blocked view.We remain blocked from making any progress with the project.He is blocked so he can't contact me on Facebook, Twitter or Instagram.

block

Add to word list
a blocked bank account is one that money cannot be removed from: The money was put into a blocked account to which she had no access.
